text: The 1969 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 87th year in Major League Baseball, their twelfth year in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their tenth at Candlestick Park. The team finished second in the newly established National League West with a record of 90–72, 3 games behind the Atlanta Braves, their fifth consecutive season of finishing second. The Giants set a Major League record which still stands for the most double plays grounded into by a team in a single game, with 7 against the Houston Astros on May 4. == Offseason == * October 14, 1968: Jesús Alou was drafted from the Giants by the Montreal Expos as the 13th pick in the 1968 MLB expansion draft.Jesús Alou at Baseball-Reference * December 6, 1968: Nate Oliver was traded by the Giants to the New York Yankees for Charley Smith.Charley Smith at Baseball-Reference * March 16, 1969, Giants pitching prospect Néstor Chávez was killed in a plane crash * March 28, 1969: Charley Smith was purchased from the Giants by the Chicago Cubs. == Regular season == * July 20, 1969: Pitcher Gaylord Perry hit the first home run of his career (he hit 6). It was in the third inning off pitcher Claude Osteen.http://www.baseball-almanac.com/box- scores/boxscore.php?boxid=196907200SFN === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day starters === * Bobby Bonds * Dick Dietz * Bobby Etheridge * Jim Ray Hart * Ron Hunt * Hal Lanier * Juan Marichal * Willie Mays * Willie McCovey === Notable transactions === * August 8, 1969: The Giants traded a player to be named later to the Detroit Tigers for Don McMahon.
